metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0171 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. The existing KVM SEV API has avulnerability that allows a non-root (host) user-level application to crashthe host kernel by creating a confidential guest VM instance in AMD CPUthat supports Secure Encrypted Virtualization (SEV).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
